seo.title: Personal Belongings Shipping Germany to Russia | Intrelo
seo.description: International moving from Germany to Russia. Professional packing, customs clearance, door-to-door delivery via transit countries. Sanctions-compliant legal routes. 20 years experience.

og.title: Moving from Germany to Russia — Door-to-Door Service
og.description: Professional packing, customs, door-to-door delivery via legal transit routes.

lsi_keywords: household goods shipping germany to russia
door to door moving germany russia
how much does it cost to move from germany to russia

hero.subtitle: We were the official carrier of the Queen of Britain. Door-to-door service from any city in Germany to any city in Russia. Professional packing, export and import customs clearance, delivery to your door. Sanctions-compliant legal transit routes through third countries.

process.title: How your move from Germany to Russia works
process.subtitle: Due to sanctions, there is no direct route between Germany and Russia. Goods travel via transit countries with 4+ reloadings — each stage under our full control.

items.text: Consultation — send photos/video of your belongings via WhatsApp. Free on-site survey anywhere in Germany.
On-site packing — 5-layer cardboard, plywood crates, bubble wrap. Photo inventory of every item.
Consolidation warehouse — palletising, labelling, export documentation preparation.
EU export customs — Ausfuhranmeldung, T1 transit, CMR and invoice preparation.
Transit via third countries — Turkey, Georgia, Kazakhstan. Route optimised for speed and safety.
Russian import customs — personal belongings clearance under simplified procedure.

cards.title: Delivery to your door in Russia

items.text: Delivery across Russia — from port or terminal to your new address in any Russian city.
Floor-level delivery — porters, rigging, crane lift through window if needed.
Unpacking, furniture assembly, placement. Packaging disposal included.

packing.title: Professional packing for the Germany → Russia route
packing.subtitle: Due to sanctions, cargo is reloaded at least 4 times. Our packing is engineered for multiple reloadings and customs inspections — 100% preservation.

items.text: Acid-free paper for antiques and delicate items
Multi-density bubble wrap — double layer for sanctions routes
Polyethylene foam for corners and fragile elements
5-layer corrugated boxes — reinforced for 4+ reloadings on transit route
Wardrobe boxes with hanging rails for suits and outerwear
Custom-size plywood crates — essential for fragile items
Climate crates for artwork — protection from temperature swings in transit
Wooden bracing and palletising — key protection during reloadings
Silica gel desiccants — critical for sea-leg sections of the route
Fabric garment bags for suits, furs and delicate clothing
Vacuum bags for bulky items — duvets, blankets, pillows
Individual shoe packaging with shape keepers
Anti-static film — protection from static during multiple reloadings
Original boxes or custom crating for household appliances
Foam inserts and securing brackets for safe transit
Multi-layer dish packing — paper, film, cell dividers
Telescopic picture boxes with shock absorption
Custom foam inserts for figurines and décor

faq.title: FAQ: Moving from Germany to Russia
faq.subtitle: Answers to the most common questions about moving under sanctions

items.q: Is it possible to move from Germany to Russia under sanctions?
items.a: Yes. We use fully legal routes via third countries — Turkey, Georgia, Kazakhstan. All shipments comply with EU and Russian law. Personal belongings are not subject to sanctions.

items.q: Why is packing so critical on the DE→RU route?
items.a: There is no direct route due to sanctions. Goods are reloaded at least 4 times, including 2 customs inspections. We use 5-layer cardboard and plywood crates to guarantee 100% preservation.

items.q: What documents are needed to export from Germany?
items.a: EU export: Ausfuhranmeldung (export declaration), inventory list, passport copy. Russian import: customs declaration, simplified clearance form. We prepare all documents.

items.q: How much does moving from Germany to Russia cost?
items.a: Depends on volume and method. Road: from ~€450/m³, Sea: from ~€250/m³, Air: from ~€900/m³. One-bedroom apartment (~10 m³) — from €4,500. Quote is free.
Road via transit: 14–21 days. Air: 3–7 days. Sea: 45–75 days. Multimodal: 30–50 days.

items.q: How do I track my shipment in transit?
items.a: GPS tracking at all stages, including transit countries. Notifications at every reloading and customs point. 24/7 WhatsApp contact with your manager.

items.q: Can I ship household appliances from Germany?
items.a: Yes. Appliances ship as personal belongings. Must be used (not new in packaging). We use anti-static film and original boxes.

items.q: Do I pay duty when importing to Russia?
items.a: Personal belongings are duty-free when relocating permanently (12+ months abroad). Otherwise: duty-free up to 200 kg / €1,000. Above: 30% duty.
All shipments insured at 100% value at every stage, including transit countries. Damage claim and compensation within 14 days.
Yes. Corporate relocations, office equipment, consolidated freight. EU-entity invoicing, deferred payment, SLA.
